title: Officers respond to a goat and dog taking a stroll together on a Twin Cities highway
title_page: Officers respond to a goat and dog taking a stroll together on a Twin Cities highway
maintext:
Officers respond to a goat and dog taking a stroll together on a Twin Cities highway
Two unlikely buddies were spotted taking a casual stroll together down a highway near Hastings this weekend a goat and a dog.
This really happened, the Minnesota State Patrol said after posting photos of the cute duo on their Twitter account.
Passing motorists contained the two to keep them safe before officers responded to the call of a loose goat and dog walking down Highway 61 around 4 p.m. on Saturday.
Lt. Shank kept the two pals company until the Humane Society showed up, the State Patrol said.
Its not entirely clear how the duo ended up on the highway but luckily their owner reclaimed them and they were safely returned to their family, the Humane Society said.
They were quite the pair, very attached to one another, according to animal control, who brought the pets to the Humane Society.
